info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 10 at 3:40PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT SATURDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Saturday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT... Smoke from new fires in western areas of the state and the two largest fires will tend to drift toward the southeast through the remainder of the afternoon and evening. Transport winds from the northwest around 10 mph or less for most areas along and west of the central mountain chain will gradually shift more westerly on Saturday but remain light. Light and more variable wind conditions expected in the vicinity of the Black fire. Significant impacts from new and residual smoke will be localized and in close proximity to individual fires through Saturday morning. New fires caused by recent lightning activity may also contribute additional smoke to regional airsheds going into Saturday as hot and dry conditions dominate. * WHERE... Significant smoke impacts will be localized across portions of northern Grant and western Sierra counties. Elsewhere, brief moderate impacts are expected at times between the Rio Grande Valley and Continental Divide but widespread unhealthy conditions are not expected. More details and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov * WHEN... Remainder of this afternoon through at least 1pm MDT Saturday, June 11th.
